definition: a plant of the pea family. There are several types of vetch, one of which is used as food for farm animals.
to separate the pieces of string, rope, etc. that form a knot in something; to remove the string, rope, etc. from something that is tied
a garden tool like a very large pair of scissors, used for cutting bushes and hedges
a metal material made from iron and steel and covered with a layer of tin
to do things or move without hurrying, especially when you are doing something that you enjoy and that is not important
a short piece of wood, metal or plastic used for holding things together, hanging things on, marking a position, etc.
a small pointed piece of wood or metal that you attach to the ropes of a tent and push into the ground in order to hold the tent in place
a piece of wood or plastic used for attaching wet clothes to a clothes line
a short piece of wood, metal or plastic that you turn to make the strings of a musical instrument tighter or looser
a small amount of a drink, especially a strong alcoholic one
to make somebody realize that they are not as good, important, etc. as they think they are
made to a standard average size and not made especially to fit you
something that gives you an excuse or opportunity to discuss or explain something
a person who does not feel happy or comfortable in a particular situation, or who is not suitable for it
material twisted together in the style of a basket
the skill of using your hands to make baskets, etc.
to dismiss somebody from a job
(of an army, etc., especially in the past) to destroy things and steal property in a town or building
to knock down the quarterback
a tool used for scraping, for example for scraping mud from shoes or ice from a car
a long line or series of marks that is left by somebody/something
a track, sign or smell that is left behind and that can be followed, especially in hunting
a path through the countryside
a route that is followed for a particular purpose
to be the first to do or to discover something that others follow
to start a journey
close to catching or finding the person or thing that you have been running after or searching for
to live somewhere
to spread an oily or soft substance over a surface in a rough or careless way
to make something dirty or greasy
to damage somebody’s reputation by saying unpleasant things about them that are not true
to rub writing, a drawing, etc. so that it is no longer clear; to become not clear in this way
to fall in small drops
to produce or let fall drops of liquid
to contain or hold a lot of something
to fall noisily onto a surface
to make somebody/something wet by making water, mud, etc. fall on them/it
to move through water making drops fly everywhere
to decorate something with areas of bright colour, not in a regular pattern
having no strength or energy
not stiff or strong

a vehicle for travelling over snow and ice, with long narrow pieces of wood or metal instead of wheels. Larger sledges are pulled by horses or dogs and smaller ones are used for going down hills as a sport or for pleasure.
to put something quickly into a liquid and take it out again
to go downwards or to a lower level; to make something do this
if you dip your headlights when driving a car at night, you make the light from them point down so that other drivers do not have the light in their eyes
when farmers dip animals, especially sheep, they put them in a bath of a liquid containing chemicals in order to kill insects, etc.
to spend some of your own money on something
to start doing something very carefully to see if it will be successful or not
to have to pay somebody for something that you have already received or return money that you have borrowed
to feel that you ought to do something for somebody or give them something, especially because they have done something for you
to exist or be successful because of the help or influence of somebody/something
to have to obey and support somebody who is in a position of authority or power
having a sharp end
aimed in a clear and often critical way against a particular person or their behaviour
to breathe air in through your nose in a way that makes a sound, especially when you are crying, have a cold, etc.
to breathe air in through the nose in order to discover or enjoy the smell of something
to say something in a way that shows that you are annoyed, unhappy or not satisfied or that you do not approve of somebody/something
good enough to be accepted or considered seriously
having a pleasant smell
making a lot of noise
strongly expressed
talking very loudly, too much and in a way that is annoying
too bright and not showing good taste
to take a piece of somebody’s skin and press it together hard with your thumb and the finger next to it
to hold something tightly between the thumb and finger or between two things that are pressed together

to place the thumb and a finger of one hand on the screen of an electronic device such as a mobile phone or small computer and move them together or apart, to make the image on the screen appear smaller or larger
if something such as a shoe pinches part of your body, it hurts you because it is too tight
to steal something, especially something small and not very valuable
to cost a person or an organization a lot of money or more than they can spend
to arrest somebody
to try to spend as little money as possible
having wrinkles
of poorer quality or lower standard; more unpleasant
more serious or severe
more ill or unhappy
used to say that somebody is not really as angry or as aggressive as they sound
to lose a fight, competition, etc. or suffer more compared with others
a terrible thing that could happen
to get even worse
used to show that you are disappointed about something
to legally control a country or its people and be responsible for introducing new laws, organizing public services, etc.
to control or influence somebody/something or how something happens, functions, etc.
if a word governs another word or phrase, it affects how that word or phrase is formed or used
a person who has been given the freedom of a particular city as a reward for the work that they have done
a person who is not a slave
to throw something somewhere in a careless way
to put something somewhere where it hangs loosely
to put somebody somewhere by force; to make somebody leave somewhere
to go away
a type of cloth made of threads that produce a pattern of small holes like a net
tights or stockings made of fishnet
a short sword with a curved metal cutting edge that was used as a weapon by sailors and pirates in the past
a ship that has weapons and that is used in war
an act or a way of punishing somebody
rough treatment
a category of very severe punishment that is banned under US law
an official judgement made in court or at an inquest (= an official investigation into somebody's death)
a decision that you make or an opinion that you give about something, after you have tested it or considered it carefully
the act of circumcising somebody; the religious ceremony when somebody, especially a baby, is circumcised
the act of somebody becoming a member of a group, often with a special ceremony; the act of introducing somebody to an activity or skill
the act of starting something
a person in some religions and societies who is believed to be able to contact good and evil spirits and cure people of illnesses
a small flat round piece of medicine that you swallow whole, without biting it
a pill that some women take to prevent them becoming pregnant
an annoying person
a fact or an event that is unpleasant and difficult to accept
to do something that makes an unpleasant situation seem less unpleasant
to make a small hole in something, or to go through something, with a sharp object
to be suddenly seen or heard
to force a way through a barrier
to remove something that is covering something
to discover something that was previously hidden or secret
a fruit like a large banana, but less sweet, that is cooked and eaten as a vegetable
a wild plant with small green flowers and broad flat leaves that spread out close to the ground
to hit somebody/something hard, especially with your closed hand
to fall on or hit a surface hard, with a loud sound; to make something do this
to beat strongly
to go or be somewhere where you are not wanted or are not supposed to be
to enter into something in a way that is not wanted or to have an unpleasant effect on it
to try to find out information about other people’s private lives in a way that is annoying or rude
to use force to separate something from something else
to push a pointed object into somebody/something, or in the direction of somebody/something, with a sudden strong movement
to vaccinate somebody against a disease
to push somebody/something with your finger or with a pointed object
to try to make somebody do something, especially when they are unwilling
the state of continuing to exist or function
a decision that a court case should be heard later
to move by jumping on one foot
to move by jumping with all or both feet together
to go or move somewhere quickly and suddenly
to get on a plane, bus, etc.
to change from one activity or subject to another
usually used in orders to tell somebody to go away
used to tell somebody to hurry and do something quickly
